allocateEpochYield(uint256).details: Only callable by an address with the ADMIN_ROLE. The amount should not exceed `getCurrentEpochYield()`. This function will call `allocateVaultYield` on the `epochManager`.

params.amount: The amount of yield to allocate.

approve(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-approve}. NOTE: If `value` is the maximum `uint256`, the allowance is not updated on `transferFrom`. This is semantically equivalent to an infinite approval. Requirements: - `spender` cannot be the zero address.

params._asset: The address of the underlying ERC20 asset.
params._lendingManagerAddress: The address of the LendingManager contract, can be address(0) initially.
params._name: The name of the vault's ERC20 shares.
params._symbol: The symbol of the vault's ERC20 shares.
params.initialAdmin: The address to be granted ADMIN_ROLE and DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE.

decimals().details: Decimals are computed by adding the decimal offset on top of the underlying asset's decimals. This "original" value is cached during construction of the vault contract. If this read operation fails (e.g., the asset has not been created yet), a default of 18 is used to represent the underlying asset's decimals. See {IERC20Metadata-decimals}.

deposit(uint256,address).details: Users should use `depositForCollection` instead to associate deposits with a collection.

params.assets: The amount of assets to deposit.
params.receiver: The address to receive the shares.

depositForCollection(uint256,address,add.details: This function mints vault shares to the `receiver` and tracks the assets for the `collectionAddress`.

params.assets: The amount of underlying assets to deposit.
params.collectionAddress: The address of the collection associated with this deposit.
params.receiver: The address that will receive the minted shares.

returns.shares: The amount of vault shares minted to the receiver.

getCurrentEpochYield().details: This is the difference between total assets in the lending manager and the total principal deposited.

returns.availableYield: The total yield available for allocation.

returns.amount: The amount of yield allocated by this vault for the given epoch.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

mint(uint256,address).details: Users should use `mintForCollection` instead to associate deposits with a collection.

params.receiver: The address to receive the shares.
params.shares: The amount of shares to mint.

returns.assets: The amount of underlying assets required.

mintForCollection(uint256,address,addres.details: This function calculates the required assets for the given shares and tracks them for the `collectionAddress`.

params.collectionAddress: The address of the collection associated with this mint.
params.receiver: The address that will receive the minted shares.
params.shares: The amount of vault shares to mint.

returns.assets: The amount of underlying assets that were deposited to mint the shares.

name().details: Returns the name of the token.

pause().details: This function can only be called by an address with the ADMIN_ROLE. All pausable functions will revert when the contract is paused.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

redeem(uint256,address,address).details: Users should use `redeemForCollection` instead to track redemptions against a collection.

params.owner: The address whose shares are burned.
params.receiver: The address to receive the assets.
params.shares: The amount of shares to redeem.

returns.assets: The amount of underlying assets withdrawn.

redeemForCollection(uint256,address,addr.details: This function burns shares from the `owner` and transfers assets to the `receiver`. It also updates the tracked assets for the `collectionAddress`. Handles dust remaining in the LendingManager during full redemptions.

params.collectionAddress: The address of the collection associated with this redemption.
params.owner: The address whose shares will be burned.
params.receiver: The address that will receive the underlying assets.
params.shares: The amount of vault shares to burn.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setCollectionRewardSharePercentage(addre.details: Only callable by an address with the ADMIN_ROLE. The percentage is in basis points (e.g., 100 = 1%).

params.percentage: The new reward share percentage in basis points.

setEpochManager(address).details: Only callable by an address with the ADMIN_ROLE.

params._epochManagerAddress: The new address of the EpochManager contract.

setLendingManager(address).details: Only callable by an address with the ADMIN_ROLE.

params._lendingManagerAddress: The new address of the LendingManager contract.

setRewardsControllerRole(address).details: Only callable by an address with the ADMIN_ROLE.

params.newRewardsController: The address to grant the REWARDS_CONTROLLER_ROLE to.

symbol().details: Returns the symbol of the token, usually a shorter version of the name.

totalAssets().details: This includes assets held directly by the vault and those deposited in the LendingManager.

transfer(address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transfer}. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - the caller must have a balance of at least `value`.

transferFrom(address,address,uint256).details: See {IERC20-transferFrom}. Skips emitting an {Approval} event indicating an allowance update. This is not required by the ERC. See {xref-ERC20-_approve-address-address-uint256-bool-}[_approve]. NOTE: Does not update the allowance if the current allowance is the maximum `uint256`. Requirements: - `from` and `to` cannot be the zero address. - `from` must have a balance of at least `value`. - the caller must have allowance for ``from``'s tokens of at least `value`.

transferYieldBatch(address[],uint256[],u.details: Only callable by an address with the REWARDS_CONTROLLER_ROLE. Validates each collection's yield amount against its allowed share.

params.amounts: Array of yield token amounts to transfer for each corresponding collection.
params.collections: Array of collection addresses for which yield is being transferred.
params.recipient: The address to receive the total transferred yield.
params.totalAmount: The total sum of all amounts to transfer in this batch.

unpause().details: This function can only be called by an address with the ADMIN_ROLE. All pausable functions will resume normal operation when unpaused.

withdraw(uint256,address,address).details: Users should use `withdrawForCollection` instead to track withdrawals against a collection.

params.assets: The amount of assets to withdraw.
params.owner: The address whose shares are burned.
params.receiver: The address to receive the assets.

withdrawForCollection(uint256,address,ad.details: This function burns shares from the `owner` and transfers assets to the `receiver`. It also updates the tracked assets for the `collectionAddress`.

params.assets: The amount of underlying assets to withdraw.
params.collectionAddress: The address of the collection associated with this withdrawal.
params.owner: The address whose shares will be burned.
params.receiver: The address that will receive the withdrawn assets.

returns.shares: The amount of vault shares burned.

allocateEpochYield(uint256).notice: Allocates a specific amount of this vault's yield to the current epoch via the EpochManager.

collectionRewardSharePercentage(address).notice: Stores the reward share percentage for each collection (basis points, 10000 = 100%).

collectionTotalAssetsDeposited(address).notice: Tracks the total assets deposited by each collection.

collectionYieldTransferred(address).notice: Tracks the total yield transferred to each collection.

deposit(uint256,address).notice: Disables the direct ERC4626 deposit function.

depositForCollection(uint256,address,add.notice: Deposits assets into the vault on behalf of a specific collection.

epochYieldAllocations(uint256).notice: Tracks yield allocated by this vault for a specific epoch.

getCurrentEpochYield().notice: Calculates the total yield currently available in the vault that can be allocated to an epoch.

getEpochYieldAllocated(uint256).notice: Returns the amount of yield this vault has allocated for a specific epoch.

mint(uint256,address).notice: Disables the direct ERC4626 mint function.

mintForCollection(uint256,address,addres.notice: Mints a specified amount of vault shares to a receiver on behalf of a collection.

redeem(uint256,address,address).notice: Disables the direct ERC4626 redeem function.

redeemForCollection(uint256,address,addr.notice: Redeems a specified amount of vault shares for underlying assets on behalf of a collection.

setCollectionRewardSharePercentage(addre.notice: Sets the reward share percentage for a specific collection.

setEpochManager(address).notice: Sets or updates the address of the EpochManager contract.

setLendingManager(address).notice: Sets or updates the address of the LendingManager contract.

setRewardsControllerRole(address).notice: Grants the REWARDS_CONTROLLER_ROLE to a new address.

totalAssets().notice: Returns the total amount of underlying assets managed by the vault.

transferYieldBatch(address[],uint256[],u.notice: Transfers accrued base yield for multiple collections in a single batch to a recipient.

withdraw(uint256,address,address).notice: Disables the direct ERC4626 withdraw function.

withdrawForCollection(uint256,address,ad.notice: Withdraws a specified amount of underlying assets from the vault on behalf of a collection.
